conclusion: Suitcase with mass 15 kg is pulled with 90 N force at angle θ to move uniformly on horizontal surface.
Net force is zero since suitcase moves uniformly.
Free-body diagram includes weight, normal force, pulling force, and frictional force.
Frictional force is proportional to normal force: f = μN.
Resolve pulling force into horizontal (F cos θ) and vertical (F sin θ) components.
Vertical forces balance: mg - N + F sin θ = 0, so N = mg + F sin θ.
Horizontal forces balance: F cos θ - μN = 0.
Substitute N: F cos θ = μ(mg + F sin θ).
Consider condition for minimum pulling force: F cos θ = μN.
Attempt to express μ in terms of θ.
Consider taking derivative of F with respect to θ to find minimum.
Plug in F = 90 N, m = 15 kg, g = 10 m/s²: 90 cos θ = μ(150 + 90 sin θ).
Attempt to solve for μ and θ.
